text: The hematopoietic transcription factor <extra_id_0> PU.1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is downregulated in human multiple myeloma cell lines .
<extra_id_0> PU.1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is a hematopoietic transcription factor belonging to the Ets-family .
It is identical to the <extra_id_0> Spi-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> oncogene , which is implicated in spleen focus - forming virus - induced murine erythroleukemias .

<extra_id_0> PU.1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> seems to be required for early development of multiple hematopoietic lineages , but its expression in mature cells is preferentially observed in cells of the B-cell-and monocyte / macrophage-differentiation lineage .
It binds the so-called Pu box , an important tissue - specific regulatory DNA element present in a number of genes expressed in these cell lineages .

We have analyzed the expression and activity of <extra_id_0> PU.1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> during human B-cell development using a panel of B-cell lines representing different stages of maturation , from early precursors to differentiated plasma cells .

text: <extra_id_0> PU.1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA expression and <extra_id_0> PU.1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> DNA binding activity , as measured by Northern blot analysis and electrophoretic mobility shift assay , respectively , were evident in cell lines representing pro-B , pre-B , and mature B cells .

text: We could also show Pu box - dependent transactivation of a reporter gene in transient transfections in these cell lines .

In contrast , in a number of multiple myeloma cell lines , representing differentiated , plasma cell-like B cells , <extra_id_0> PU.1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> DNA binding activity , mRNA expression , and Pu box - dependent transactivation were absent or detectable at a very low level .

text: In lymphoblastoid cell lines , which exemplify an intermediate stage of B-cell differentiation , a reduced expression and activity were observed .

text: The findings in the human multiple myeloma cell lines represent the first examples of B cells with downregulated <extra_id_0> PU.1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression and apparently contradict observations in the murine system in which <extra_id_0> PU.1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is expressed and active in plasmacytoma cell lines .

text: At present , it is unclear whether the lack of <extra_id_0> PU.1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression and activity in human multiple myeloma cell lines represents a malignancy - associated defect in these cells or exemplifies a normal developmental regulation in terminally differentiated B cells .
